{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3488139,"name":"","username":"2PBHD","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/2/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T16:10:30.767Z","cooked":"

When connecting to a robot with missing sparkmaxes, revlib starts using an exceptional amount of memory, causing an overflow at 10-11 missing. This is an issue as my team likes to test individual pieces of our robot on smaller test bots, yet is unable to do so because of this.
Would there be a way to detct whether a sparkmax is connected, and avoid attempting a connection in that case?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T16:10:30.767Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":45.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482747,"topic_slug":"revlib-memory-overlow","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67108,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/revlib-memory-overlow/482747/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3488144,"name":"neev dadhania","username":"nevadexehs","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T16:17:38.593Z","cooked":"

what do you mean by “missing sparkmaxes”?

Not a direct answer to your question, but please share what firmware version your sparkmax’s are, and what version of revlib you’re using. If I remember correctly, there was an issue discovered which caused increased memory usage that was resolved in an update.

Missing sparkmaxes would be ones which our program instantiates, but are not plugged in on the actual robot.

We updated our sparks and revlib last week, so they should be the latest ones

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T00:23:58.099Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482747,"topic_slug":"revlib-memory-overlow","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67108,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/revlib-memory-overlow/482747/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488619,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T00:41:48.178Z","cooked":"

Please check and report back with specific version numbers. It’s very easy for them to have been the latest at the time but have a newer version release since, or for it to have been the latest your PC knew about but there be an update it didn’t prompt you for.

Generally speaking, “latest” is a fairly useless term in a support context.

Edit: spellcheck was not my friend today…

Most of the YAGSL problems teams have had in the last week were fixed by updating
